Description: One pendant, one spacer-bead and seven beads made of different materials. A: Small pendant made of brown-white stone (pebble-like), roughly drop-shaped with a perforation at the top. Thickens out towards the bottom. B: Relatively large spacer-bead made of turquoise faience. Three segments long, one of them partly broken, slightly flattened. C: One barrel-shaped bead made of a whitish stone, probably calcite, slightly irregular in shape. D: One flattened spherical bead made of carnelian, only roughly smoothed, perforation drilled from both ends, the diameter varies from 0.17-0.56cm. E: Three flattened spherical beads in different sizes made of faience, one white, one light blue, one vivid turquoise. F: Two disc-shaped beads, one made of white faience, one of ostrich eggshell.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
